item.title: Kenny add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "It is the writer's privilege to help man endure by lifting his heart." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Kenny add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "Books aren't written - they're rewritten. Including your own. It is one of the hardest things to accept, especially after the seventh rewrite hasn't quite done it." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Kenny add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When I face the desolate impossibility of writing five hundred pages, a sick sense of failure falls on me, and I know I can never do it. Then gradually, I write one page and then another. One day's work is all I can permit myself to contemplate." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kenny add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Good writing is supposed to evoke sensation in the readerâ€”not the fact that it is raining, but the feeling of being rained upon." -- E.L. Doctorow
